Q. Du
dcterms:description: The Chikusei dataset was taken by the Hyperspec-VNIR-C sensor in Chikusei, Japan. It contains 128 bands with wavelengths ranging from 343nm to 1018nm, and has a spatial resolution of 2.5m. The dataset includes 19 classes of land cover, including urban and rural areas.
dcterms:title: Chikusei

dcterms:creator: Z. Li
M. Liu
Y. Chen
Y. Xu
Q. Du
dcterms:description: The Indian Pines dataset was imaged by an airborne visible infrared imaging spectrometer (AVIRIS) in Indiana, USA. It contains 200 bands with wavelengths ranging from 0.4 to 2.5 micrometers, and has a size of 145 × 145 pixels with a spatial resolution of about 20m. The dataset includes 16 classes of land cover, including crops and natural vegetation.
dcterms:title: Indian Pines

dcterms:creator: Z. Li
M. Liu
Y. Chen
Y. Xu
Q. Du
dcterms:description: The Pavia University dataset was imaged by the German airborne reflective optical spectral imager (ROSIS) in the city of Pavia, Italy. It contains 103 wavebands, with a size of 610 × 340 pixels and a spatial resolution of about 1.3m. The dataset includes 9 classes of land cover, including trees, asphalt roads, and bricks.
dcterms:title: Pavia University

dcterms:creator: Z. Li
M. Liu
Y. Chen
Y. Xu
Q. Du
dcterms:description: The Salinas dataset was captured by the airborne visible infrared imaging spectrometer (AVIRIS) in the Salinas Valley, California, USA. It contains 204 wavebands with a size of 512 × 217 pixels, and a spatial resolution of about 3.7m. The dataset includes 16 classes of land cover, which include vegetables and exposed soil.
dcterms:title: Salinas
